document.title: SSA-110665: STEP7 Vulnerability in DLL Loading Mechanism

notes.title: Summary
notes.text:
Insecure loading of DLLs from SIMATIC STEP7 project folders 
 
CVSS Base Score 6.9 
CVSS Temporal Score 6.0 
CVSS Overall Score 6.0 (AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C) 
 
Mitigating Factors 
An attacker must have access to a STEP7 project file folder (e.g., on a file share or 
have knowledge of log-in credentials on the system). 
 
 
SOLUTION 
Siemens provided the STEP7 software updates V5.5 HF6 and V5.5 SP1 (equivalent to 
version 5.5.1) that fix the vulnerability, but recommends that the latest Service Pack, 
V5.5 SP2 [1], should be installed as soon as possible. For PCS 7 users these fixes are 
incorporated in PCS 7 V7.1 SP4 and PCS 7 V8.0. Users of PCS 7 V7.1 SP3 can manually 
update to STEP7 V5.5 HF6 to correct this problem. 
Siemens Security Advisory by Siemens ProductCERT  
 
SSA-110665  Â© Siemens AG 2012 Page 2 of 2   
The updates implement a mechanism that rejects DLLs in the STEP7 project folders which 
contain executable code, thus preventing unintended execution of unchecked code. 
 
OTHER MITIGATIONS 
Industrial security is a serious topic, and Siemens recognizes that achieving maximal 
security requires a holistic approach. In addition to the solution described above, we 
strongly urge customers to learn more about the Siemens Industrial Security Concept [2].
